job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in Boston, MA
pros: Local and easily accessible. Very nice and quiet area of stoughton.
cons: Patiently acquitted did not always factor into patient assignments.

review_title: The employer is also on a 90 day probation too.
pros: Pay, location, free parking, friendly patients
cons: Cafeteria time, lunch time, low morale

pros: The nurses I worked with were phenomenal. The nursing supervisors are so helpful and are willing to break their backs for their fellow nurse and their patients.
cons: Poor pay, no incentives to keep staff, raises don't exist in this facility, patient's at this facility are high acuity and the patient:nurse ratio is much too high. The Chief of Nursing doesn't care about her employees and states we should be able to do our jobs regardless of how many patients we have. I have never seen any of the upper management nurses actually work the floor with the exception of the nursing supervisors.

job_title: Staff Registered Respiratory Therapist in Stoughton, MA
pros: Love the rehabilitation aspect of the job.
cons: Bad management, do not care about employees, every is about business.

pros: Teamwork and dedication of nurse supervisors
cons: Low pay, lack of appreciation

pros: it is a good place to learn and gain experience

pros: I no longer work there.
cons:
Nursing boss doesn't care about her staff.  Stressful everyday-to many pts to take care of-new nurse oreinteton pitiful-everybody new-no one there to answer ur ?'s.Pts so sick-need more exp staff.  I hated every min i was there-

pros: I was employed at Sinai for 25+ years, and the experience (work environment, cooperation, acknowledgement) was great until the hospital was acquired by Steward.  Sinai was truly a family of great, talented, compassionate, caring people working together to provide the very best in patient care
cons: Little/no regard for employees as "people". It became all about the bottom line.  I understand that you must be fiscally responsible, but at what cost?

job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant in Dorchester, NE
pros: The teamwork environment especially that of the night shift is very positive. Nursing team collaborates together and truly care about the patient population.
cons: There is a lack of resources (medical supplies), and outdated documentation system. It would be great to have all of the patient documentation be electronic versus partially electronic and partially on paper.

pros:
Great benefits and health insurance...as long as you see a Steward doctor.
Some of the veteran staff that have stayed are the best I've ever worked with.
cons: All the good staff have left. Management does not care. Grossly under staffed and under paid. New RN's are new grads. New CNA's only have nursing home experience. Both are very scary because the patient acuity is so high.

review_title: It was a mixed bag, sometimes good, but often a tough place to work.
pros: Good benefits and close camaraderie between staff were great perks. Having an employee of the month and year was a great morale booster.
cons: The tendency of staff to stay for years and years led to some superior supervisors, but also some that were no longer effective.

pros: Great experience for a new graduate especially if you want to work in an ICU eventually, helpful and welcoming staff especially on night shift
cons: Poor management. very understaffed, suggestions for improvement are not carried up the chain of command and therefore nothing is done about major issues with staffing.

review_title: Hospital in transition from Steward acquisition but future looks positive.
pros: Great President, empowers employees to make suggestions for changes to improve quality and safety, and reduce expenses. Truly comes from the top down.
cons: Employees still living in past from before Steward acquisition.  Some need to embrace changes and move on.

job_title: Registered Nurse II in Stoughton, MA
pros: It is a good place to go to get experience.  You will see and learn a lot at this hospital.
cons: No raises, They do not value their employees here at all!  There are no incentives to stay at this hospital whatsoever.

pros: This company was always willing to train you to do more and advance your position accordingly.
cons: There are no cons to working for this company

pros: nice place to work met a lot wonderful people.
cons: environment was a little negative and the building is a bit old.
